message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The trinucleotide repeat expansion on chromosome 9 is associated with Friedreich's ataxia, a disease inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern. Von Gierke's disease is also inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern. Osteogenesis imperfecta is inherited in an autosomal dominant pattern. Menke's disease and Leber hereditary optic neuropathy are inherited in an X-linked recessive pattern.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The trinucleotide repeat expansion on chromosome 9 suggests that this patient has Friedreich's ataxia, an autosomal recessive disorder. Von Gierke's disease is also an autosomal recessive disorder, making it the most similar in terms of inheritance. Osteogenesis imperfecta is an autosomal dominant disorder, Menke's disease is an X-linked recessive disorder, and Leber hereditary optic neuropathy is a mitochondrial disorder.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The trinucleotide repeat expansion on chromosome 9 is a characteristic of Friedreich's ataxia. This disease displays an autosomal recessive mode of inheritance. Similarly, Von Gierke's disease also displays an autosomal recessive mode of inheritance. Osteogenesis imperfecta displays an autosomal dominant mode of inheritance, Menke's disease displays an X-linked recessive mode of inheritance, and Leber hereditary optic neuropathy displays a mitochondrial mode of inheritance.
